page.title: 05Economics of CARE
page.content: CARE villages now have total assets in property of some Â£4 million and look after the well being of 254 mentally handicapped people. CARE has to find by fund raising,all the capital costs of aquiring and developing property to make it suitable for occupation,for building and equiping workshops and,currently, the average per capita cost of establishing all facilities is running at about Â£220,000 per head. This of course is subject like everything else,to inflation.The fees charged to Local Authorities,which in 90% of cases support the villagers are established each year in the form of a forecast for the following year based on current costing & are submitted to & agreed by Leicestershire on behalf of all other Local Authorities.
